info.title: SalesLoft Platform
info.description: SalesLoft helps transform sales teams into modern sales organizations  - converting more target accounts into customer accounts

get.description:
Authenticated user information. This endpoint does not accept any parameters as it is
represents your authenticated user. The "Users" resource provides user information
for other users on the team.
Fetches the team of the authenticated user.

Fetches multiple account records. The records can be filtered, paged, and sorted according to
the respective parameters.

parameters.description: IDs of accounts to fetch. If a record can't be found, that record won't be returned and your request will be successful
parameters.name: ids

parameters.description: Filters accounts by crm_id. Multiple crm ids can be applied
parameters.name: crm_id

parameters.description: Filters accounts by the tags applied to the account. Multiple tags can be applied
parameters.name: tag
updated_at

parameters.description: Domain of the accounts to fetch. Domains are unique and lowercase
parameters.name: domain

parameters.description: Filters accounts by archived_at status. Returns only accounts where archived_at is not null if this field is true. Returns only accounts where archived_at is null if this field is false. Do not pass this parameter to return both archived and unarchived accounts. This filter is not applied if any value other than "true" or "false" is passed.
parameters.name: archived

parameters.description: Names of accounts to fetch. Name matches are exact and case sensitive. Multiple names can be fetched.
parameters.name: name

parameters.description: Filters accounts by account_stage_id. Multiple account_stage_ids can be applied
parameters.name: account_stage_id

parameters.description: Key to sort on, must be one of: created_at, updated_at, last_contacted_at, account_stage, account_tier. Defaults to updated_at
parameters.name: sort_by

parameters.description: Direction to sort in, must be one of: ASC, DESC. Defaults to DESC
parameters.name: sort_direction

parameters.description: How many records to show per page in the range [1, 100]. Defaults to 25
parameters.name: per_page

parameters.description: The current page to fetch results from. Defaults to 1
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Whether to include total_pages and total_count in the metadata. Defaults to false
parameters.name: include_paging_counts

post.description:
Creates an account.

"domain" must be unique on the current team.

parameters.description: Account Full Name
parameters.name: name

parameters.description: Website domain, not a fully qualified URI
parameters.name: domain

parameters.description: Conversational name of the Account
parameters.name: conversational_name

parameters.description: Description
parameters.name: description

parameters.description: Phone number without formatting
parameters.name: phone

parameters.description: Website
parameters.name: website

parameters.description: Full LinkedIn url
parameters.name: linkedin_url

parameters.description: Twitter handle, with @
parameters.name: twitter_handle

parameters.description: Street name and number
parameters.name: street

parameters.description: City
parameters.name: city

parameters.description: State
parameters.name: state

parameters.description: Postal code
parameters.name: postal_code

parameters.description: Country
parameters.name: country

parameters.description: Time locale
parameters.name: locale

parameters.description: Industry
parameters.name: industry

parameters.description: Type of the Account's company
parameters.name: company_type

parameters.description: Date or year of founding
parameters.name: founded

parameters.description: Estimated revenue range
parameters.name: revenue_range

parameters.description: Estimated number of people in employment
parameters.name: size

parameters.description: Whether this company can not be contacted. Values are either true or false. Setting this to true will remove all associated people from all active communications
parameters.name: do_not_contact

parameters.description: Custom fields are defined by the user's team. Only fields with values are presented in the API.
parameters.name: custom_fields

parameters.description: All tags applied to this Account
parameters.name: tags

parameters.description: ID of the User that owns this Account
parameters.name: owner_id

parameters.description: ID of the CompanyStage assigned to this Account
parameters.name: company_stage_id

get.description: Fetches an account, by ID only.

parameters.description: Account ID
parameters.name: id

put.description:
Updates an account.

"domain" must be unique on the current team.

parameters.description: Account Full Name
parameters.name: name

parameters.description: Website domain, not a fully qualified URI
parameters.name: domain

parameters.description: Conversational name of the Account
parameters.name: conversational_name

parameters.description: Description
parameters.name: description

parameters.description: Phone number without formatting
parameters.name: phone

parameters.description: Website
parameters.name: website

parameters.description: Full LinkedIn url
parameters.name: linkedin_url

parameters.description: Twitter handle, with @
parameters.name: twitter_handle

parameters.description: Street name and number
parameters.name: street

parameters.description: City
parameters.name: city

parameters.description: State
parameters.name: state

parameters.description: Postal code
parameters.name: postal_code

parameters.description: Country
parameters.name: country

parameters.description: Time locale
parameters.name: locale

parameters.description: Industry
parameters.name: industry

parameters.description: Type of the Account's company
parameters.name: company_type

parameters.description: Date or year of founding
parameters.name: founded

parameters.description: Estimated revenue range
parameters.name: revenue_range

parameters.description: Estimated number of people in employment
parameters.name: size

parameters.description: Whether this company can not be contacted. Values are either true or false. Setting this to true will remove all associated people from all active communications
parameters.name: do_not_contact

parameters.description: Custom fields are defined by the user's team. Only fields with values are presented in the API.
parameters.name: custom_fields

parameters.description: All tags applied to this Account
parameters.name: tags

parameters.description: ID of the User that owns this Account
parameters.name: owner_id

parameters.description: ID of the CompanyStage assigned to this Account
parameters.name: company_stage_id

parameters.description: Account ID
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: Whether this Account should be archived or not. Setting this to true sets archived_at to the current time if it's not already set. Setting this to false will set archived_at to null
parameters.name: archived

delete.description:
Deletes an account. This operation is not reversible without contacting support.
This operation can be called multiple times successfully.

Deleting an account will remove all connected people from that account.

parameters.description: Account ID
parameters.name: id

204.description: The Account has been deleted successfully

get.description:
Fetches multiple account stage records. The records can be filtered, paged, and sorted according to
the respective parameters.

parameters.description: IDs of account stages to fetch. If a record can't be found, that record won't be returned and your request will be successful
parameters.name: ids
updated_at

parameters.description: Key to sort on, must be one of: created_at, updated_at. Defaults to updated_at
parameters.name: sort_by

parameters.description: Direction to sort in, must be one of: ASC, DESC. Defaults to DESC
parameters.name: sort_direction

parameters.description: How many records to show per page in the range [1, 100]. Defaults to 25
parameters.name: per_page

parameters.description: The current page to fetch results from. Defaults to 1
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Whether to include total_pages and total_count in the metadata. Defaults to false
parameters.name: include_paging_counts

get.description: Fetches an account stage, by ID only.

parameters.description: Account Stage ID
parameters.name: id

Fetches multiple account tier records. The records can be filtered, paged, and sorted according to
the respective parameters.

parameters.description: IDs of Account Tiers to fetch. If a record can't be found, that record won't be returned and your request will be successful
parameters.name: ids

parameters.description: Filters Account Tiers by name. Multiple names can be applied
parameters.name: name

parameters.description: Key to sort on, must be one of: created_at, updated_at, order. Defaults to updated_at
parameters.name: sort_by

parameters.description: Direction to sort in, must be one of: ASC, DESC. Defaults to DESC
parameters.name: sort_direction

parameters.description: How many records to show per page in the range [1, 100]. Defaults to 25
parameters.name: per_page

parameters.description: The current page to fetch results from. Defaults to 1

parameters.name: include_paging_counts

get.description: Fetches an account tier, by ID only.

parameters.description: Account Tier ID
parameters.name: id

get.description:
Fetches multiple action records. The records can be filtered, paged, and sorted according to
the respective parameters. Only actions that are currently "in_progess" will be returned by
this endpoint.

By default, only the requesting user's actions will be returned by this endpoint. It is possible
for team admin users to request other users' actions by passing the user_guid parameter.

parameters.description: IDs of actions to fetch.
parameters.name: ids

parameters.description: Fetch actions by step ID
parameters.name: step_id

parameters.description: Filter actions by type
parameters.name: type
due_on

parameters.description: Filters actions by the user's guid. Multiple user guids can be applied. The user must be a team admin to filter other users' actions
parameters.name: user_guid

parameters.description: Filters actions by person_id. Multiple person ids can be applied
parameters.name: person_id

parameters.description: Key to sort on, must be one of: created_at, updated_at. Defaults to updated_at
parameters.name: sort_by

parameters.description: Direction to sort in, must be one of: ASC, DESC. Defaults to DESC
parameters.name: sort_direction

parameters.description: How many records to show per page in the range [1, 100]. Defaults to 25
parameters.name: per_page

parameters.description: The current page to fetch results from. Defaults to 1
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Whether to include total_pages and total_count in the metadata. Defaults to false
parameters.name: include_paging_counts

get.description:
Fetches an action, by ID only.
This endpoint will only return actions that are in_progress or pending_activity.
Once an action is complete, the request for that action will return a 404 status code.

parameters.description: Action ID
parameters.name: id

Fetches multiple call instruction records. The records can be filtered, paged, and sorted according to
the respective parameters.

parameters.description: IDs of call instructions to fetch.
parameters.name: ids

parameters.description: Key to sort on, must be one of: created_at, updated_at. Defaults to updated_at
parameters.name: sort_by

parameters.description: Direction to sort in, must be one of: ASC, DESC. Defaults to DESC
parameters.name: sort_direction

parameters.description: How many records to show per page in the range [1, 100]. Defaults to 25
parameters.name: per_page

parameters.description: The current page to fetch results from. Defaults to 1
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Whether to include total_pages and total_count in the metadata. Defaults to false
parameters.name: include_paging_counts

get.description: Fetches a call instruction, by ID only.

parameters.description: Call instructions ID
parameters.name: id

post.description:
Creates an activity. An activity will mark the associated action as completed. Currently,
only certain action types can have an activity explicitly created for them.

parameters.description:
Action that is being completed. This will validate that the action is still
valid before completed it. The same action can never be successfully passed twice to this endpoint.
The action must have a type of 'integration'.
parameters.name: action_id

get.description:
Fetches multiple cadence records. The records can be filtered, paged, and sorted according to
the respective parameters.

parameters.description: IDs of cadences to fetch. If a record can't be found, that record won't be returned and your request will be successful
parameters.name: ids
updated_at

parameters.description: Filters cadences by whether they are a team cadence or not
parameters.name: team_cadence

parameters.description: Filters cadences by whether they are shared
parameters.name: shared

parameters.description: Filters cadences by the owner's guid. Multiple owner guids can be applied
parameters.name: owned_by_guid

parameters.description: Filters cadences by whether they are able to have people added to them
parameters.name: people_addable

parameters.description: Key to sort on, must be one of: created_at, updated_at. Defaults to updated_at
parameters.name: sort_by

parameters.description: Direction to sort in, must be one of: ASC, DESC. Defaults to DESC
parameters.name: sort_direction

parameters.description: How many records to show per page in the range [1, 100]. Defaults to 25
parameters.name: per_page

parameters.description: The current page to fetch results from. Defaults to 1
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Whether to include total_pages and total_count in the metadata. Defaults to false
parameters.name: include_paging_counts

get.description: Fetches a cadence, by ID only.

parameters.description: Cadence ID
parameters.name: id

get.description:
Fetches multiple cadence membership records. The records can be filtered, paged, and sorted according to
the respective parameters. A cadence membership is the association between a person and their current and
historical time on a cadence. Cadence membership records are mutable and change over time. If a person is
added to a cadence and re-added to the same cadence in the future, there is a single membership record.

parameters.description: IDs of cadence memberships to fetch. If a record can't be found, that record won't be returned and your request will be successful
parameters.name: ids

parameters.description: ID of the person to find cadence memberships for
parameters.name: person_id

parameters.description: ID of the cadence to find cadence memberships for
parameters.name: cadence_id
updated_at

parameters.description: If true, return only cadence memberships for people currently on cadences.  If false, return cadence memberships for people who have been removed from or have completed a cadence.
parameters.name: currently_on_cadence

parameters.description: Key to sort on, must be one of: added_at, updated_at. Defaults to updated_at
parameters.name: sort_by

parameters.description: Direction to sort in, must be one of: ASC, DESC. Defaults to DESC
parameters.name: sort_direction

parameters.description: How many records to show per page in the range [1, 100]. Defaults to 25
parameters.name: per_page

parameters.description: The current page to fetch results from. Defaults to 1
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Whether to include total_pages and total_count in the metadata. Defaults to false
parameters.name: include_paging_counts

post.description:
Adds a person to a cadence. person_id and cadence_id are required, and must be visible to the authenticated user. user_id will
default to the authenticated user, but can be set to any visible user on the authenticated team.

A person cannot be added to a cadence on behalf of a teammate unless the cadence is a team cadence, or the cadence is owned by
the teammate.

parameters.description: ID of the person to create a cadence membership for
parameters.name: person_id

parameters.description: ID of the cadence to create a cadence membership for
parameters.name: cadence_id

parameters.description: ID of the user to create a cadence membership for. The associated cadence must be owned by the user, or it must be a team cadence
parameters.name: user_id

get.description: Fetches a cadence membership, by ID only.

parameters.description: CadenceMembership ID
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: CadenceMembership ID
parameters.name: id

204.description: The person has been removed from the cadence successfully

get.description:
Fetches multiple call data records. The records can be filtered, paged, and sorted according to
the respective parameters.

Call data records are records of all inbound and outbound calls through SalesLoft. A call data record may
be associated with a call, but does not have to be.

parameters.description: IDs of call data records to fetch. If a record can't be found, that record won't be returned and your request will be successful
parameters.name: ids

parameters.description: Return only call data records which have or do not have a call logged for them
parameters.name: has_call
created_at
updated_at

parameters.description: Filters list to only include guids
parameters.name: user_guid

parameters.description: Key to sort on, must be one of: created_at, updated_at. Defaults to updated_at
parameters.name: sort_by

parameters.description: Direction to sort in, must be one of: ASC, DESC. Defaults to DESC
parameters.name: sort_direction

parameters.description: How many records to show per page in the range [1, 100]. Defaults to 25
parameters.name: per_page

parameters.description: The current page to fetch results from. Defaults to 1
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Whether to include total_pages and total_count in the metadata. Defaults to false
parameters.name: include_paging_counts

get.description: Fetches a call data record, by ID only.

parameters.description: CallDataRecord ID
parameters.name: id

get.description:
Fetches multiple call disposition records. The records can be sorted according to
the respective parameters. Call dispositions must be configured in application. This will
change in the future, but please contact us if you have a pressing use case.

parameters.description: Key to sort on, must be one of: name, updated_at. Defaults to name
parameters.name: sort_by

parameters.description: Direction to sort in, must be one of: ASC, DESC. Defaults to ASC
parameters.name: sort_direction

parameters.description: How many records to show per page in the range [1, 100]. Defaults to 25
parameters.name: per_page

parameters.description: The current page to fetch results from. Defaults to 1
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Whether to include total_pages and total_count in the metadata. Defaults to false
parameters.name: include_paging_counts

get.description:
Fetches multiple call records. The records can be filtered, paged, and sorted according to
the respective parameters.

parameters.description: IDs of calls to fetch. If a record can't be found, that record won't be returned and your request will be successful
parameters.name: ids
updated_at

parameters.description: Key to sort on, must be one of: created_at, updated_at. Defaults to updated_at
parameters.name: sort_by

parameters.description: Direction to sort in, must be one of: ASC, DESC. Defaults to DESC
parameters.name: sort_direction

parameters.description: How many records to show per page in the range [1, 100]. Defaults to 25
parameters.name: per_page

parameters.description: The current page to fetch results from. Defaults to 1
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Whether to include total_pages and total_count in the metadata. Defaults to false
parameters.name: include_paging_counts

post.description:
Creates a call. The parameters of this endpoint can be used to create an action
and ensure that the CRM Task is mapped correctly.

parameters.description: The ID of the person whom this call will be logged for
parameters.name: person_id

parameters.description: The phone number that was called
parameters.name: to

parameters.description: The length of the call, in seconds
parameters.name: duration

parameters.description: The disposition of the call. Can be required on a per-team basis. Must be present in the disposition list.
parameters.name: disposition

parameters.description: The sentiment of the call. Can be required on a per-team basis. Must be present in the sentiment list.
parameters.name: sentiment

parameters.description: Notes to log for the call. This is similar to the notes endpoint, but ensures that the notes get synced to the user's CRM
parameters.name: notes

parameters.description: Guid of the user whom this call should be logged for. Defaults to the authenticated user. Only team admins can pass another user's guid
parameters.name: user_guid

parameters.description:
Action that this call is being logged for. This will validate that the action is still
valid before completing it. The same action can never be successfully passed twice to this endpoint. The
action must have a type of 'phone'.
parameters.name: action_id

parameters.description:
CRM specific parameters. Some parameters are required on a per-team basis. Consume the
CrmActivityFields endpoint to receive a list of valid parameters. The "field" property
is passed as the key of this object, and the value of this object is the value that you
would like to set.

If CrmActivityField has a non-null value, then that value must be submitted, or excluded
from API calls, as these values are automatically applied.
parameters.name: crm_params

parameters.description:
CallDataRecord associations that will become linked to the created call. It is possible to pass
multiple CallDataRecord ids in this field; this can be used to represent multiple phone calls
that made up a single call.

Any call data record that is used must not already be linked to a call. It is not possible
to link a call data record to multiple calls, and it is not possible to re-assign a call data
record to a different call.
parameters.name: linked_call_data_record_ids

get.description: Fetches a call, by ID only.

parameters.description: Call ID
parameters.name: id

get.description:
Fetches multiple call sentiment records. The records can be sorted according to
the respective parameters. Call sentiments must be configured in application. This will
change in the future, but please contact us if you have a pressing use case.

parameters.description: Key to sort on, must be one of: name, updated_at. Defaults to name
parameters.name: sort_by

parameters.description: Direction to sort in, must be one of: ASC, DESC. Defaults to ASC
parameters.name: sort_direction

parameters.description: How many records to show per page in the range [1, 100]. Defaults to 25
parameters.name: per_page

parameters.description: The current page to fetch results from. Defaults to 1
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Whether to include total_pages and total_count in the metadata. Defaults to false
parameters.name: include_paging_counts

get.description:
Each entry is a possible caller ID match for the number. Multiple
entries may be returned if the phone number is present on more than one
person in the system.  Phone number should be in E.164 format.

parameters.description: E.164 Phone Number
parameters.name: phone_number

parameters.description: The name of the custom field

get.description: Fetches a custom field, by ID only.

parameters.name: id

get.description:
Fetches multiple email template attachment records. The records can be filtered and paged according to
the respective parameters.

parameters.description: IDs of email template attachments to fetch. If a record can't be found, that record won't be returned and your request will be successful
parameters.name: ids

parameters.description: Filters email template attachments by email template IDs
parameters.name: email_template_id

parameters.description: How many records to show per page in the range [1, 100]. Defaults to 25
parameters.name: per_page

get.description:
Fetches multiple email template records. The records can be filtered, paged, and sorted according to
the respective parameters.

parameters.description: IDs of email templates to fetch. If a record can't be found, that record won't be returned and your request will be successful
parameters.name: ids
updated_at

parameters.description: Filters email templates by whether they are linked to a team template or not
parameters.name: linked_to_team_template

parameters.description: Filters email templates by title or subject
parameters.name: search

parameters.description: Filters email templates by tags applied to the template by tag ID, not to exceed 100 IDs
parameters.name: tag_ids

parameters.description: Filters email templates by tags applied to the template, not to exceed 100 tags
parameters.name: tag

parameters.description: Filters email templates by current authenticated user
parameters.name: filter_by_owner

parameters.description: Filters email templates by groups applied to the template by group ID. Not to exceed 500 IDs. Returns templates that are assigned to any of the group ids.
parameters.name: group_id

parameters.description: Filters email templates based on whether or not the template has been used on a cadence
parameters.name: include_cadence_templates

parameters.description: Filters email templates to include archived templates or not
parameters.name: include_archived_templates

parameters.description: Key to sort on, must be one of: created_at, updated_at, last_used_at. Defaults to updated_at
parameters.name: sort_by

parameters.description: Direction to sort in, must be one of: ASC, DESC. Defaults to DESC
parameters.name: sort_direction

parameters.description: How many records to show per page in the range [1, 100]. Defaults to 25
parameters.name: per_page

parameters.description: The current page to fetch results from. Defaults to 1
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Whether to include total_pages and total_count in the metadata. Defaults to false
parameters.name: include_paging_counts

get.description: Fetches an email template, by ID only.

parameters.description: EmailTemplate ID
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: Optionally will return the templates with the current user's email signature
parameters.name: include_signature

get.description: Fetches multiple imports.

parameters.description: IDs of imports to fetch. If a record can't be found, that record won't be returned and your request will be successful
parameters.name: ids

parameters.description: ID of users to fetch imports for. Using this filter will return an empty array for non-admin users who request other user's imports
parameters.name: user_ids

parameters.description: Key to sort on, must be one of: created_at, updated_at. Defaults to created_at
parameters.name: sort_by

parameters.description: Direction to sort in, must be one of: ASC, DESC. Defaults to DESC
parameters.name: sort_direction

parameters.description: How many records to show per page in the range [1, 100]. Defaults to 25
parameters.name: per_page

parameters.description: The current page to fetch results from. Defaults to 1
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Whether to include total_pages and total_count in the metadata. Defaults to false
parameters.name: include_paging_counts

parameters.description: ID of the User that owns this Import
parameters.name: user_id

parameters.description: Name, recommended to be easily identifiable to a user
parameters.name: name

get.description:
Fetches an import, by ID only.

Admin users can access imports for the entire team, but non-admin users can only access their own imports.

parameters.description: Import ID
parameters.name: id

put.description:
Updates an import, by ID only.

Admin users can access imports for the entire team, but non-admin users can only access their own imports.

parameters.description: Import ID
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: ID of the User that owns this Import
parameters.name: user_id

parameters.description: Name, recommended to be easily identifiable to a user
parameters.name: name

delete.description:
Deletes an import, by ID only. The associated people can be deleted as part of the deletion process.

Admin users can access imports for the entire team, but non-admin users can only access their own imports.

parameters.description: Import ID
parameters.name: id

parameters.description:
Whether to delete people on this Import. Possible values are: [not present], all, single.

'single' will delete people who are only present in this Import.
'all' will delete people even if they are present in other Imports.
Not specifying this parameter will not delete any people
parameters.name: undo

204.description: The import has been deleted successfully

parameters.description: The person to create the LiveWebsiteTrackingParameter for
parameters.name: person_id

parameters.name: associated_with_type

parameters.name: associated_with_id

This operation is not reversible without contacting support.
This operation can be called multiple times successfully.

post.description:
Creates an ongoing action. An ongoing action is an action that is not yet completed,
but progress has been made towards the completion. The user should not need to do
anything for an ongoing action to be completed. An ongoing action can be later completed
by creating an activity.

Ongoing actions are marked as status=pending_activity.

parameters.description:
Action that is being marked ongoing. This will validate that the action is still
valid before modifying it. Ongoing actions can not be marked ongoing.
parameters.name: action_id

get.description:
Fetches multiple team template records. The records can be filtered, paged, and sorted according to
the respective parameters.

Team templates are templates that are available team-wide. Admins may use
team templates to create original content for the entire team, monitor version control to ensure templates are always up to date,
and track template performance across the entire organization. All metrics on a team template reflect usage across the team; individual metrics can be found with the email_templates API endpoint.

parameters.description: IDs of team templates to fetch. If a record can't be found, that record won't be returned and your request will be successful
parameters.name: ids
updated_at

parameters.description: Filters email templates by title or subject
parameters.name: search

parameters.description: Filters email templates by tags applied to the template by tag ID, not to exceed 100 IDs
parameters.name: tag_ids

parameters.description: Filters team templates by tags applied to the template, not to exceed 100 tags
parameters.name: tag

parameters.description: Filters email templates to include archived templates or not
parameters.name: include_archived_templates

parameters.description: Key to sort on, must be one of: created_at, updated_at, last_used_at. Defaults to updated_at
parameters.name: sort_by

parameters.description: Direction to sort in, must be one of: ASC, DESC. Defaults to DESC
parameters.name: sort_direction

parameters.description: How many records to show per page in the range [1, 100]. Defaults to 25
parameters.name: per_page

parameters.description: The current page to fetch results from. Defaults to 1
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Whether to include total_pages and total_count in the metadata. Defaults to false
parameters.name: include_paging_counts

get.description:
Non Admin: Lists only your user, or all on team depending on group visibility policy
Team Admin: Lists users associated with your team

parameters.name: guid

parameters.description: Filters users by group_id
parameters.name: group_id

get.description: Fetches a user, by ID only.

parameters.description: User ID
parameters.name: id

guid.description: Globally unique user ID. New endpoints will explicitly accept this over id

created_at.description: Datetime of when the user was created

updated_at.description: Datetime of when the user was last updated

active.description: Whether an user is currently active in SalesLoft

email_client_email_address.description: Email address associated with the email client of the user

sending_email_address.description: The email address that email of the user will be sent from, resolved in the following resolution order: from_user, email_client_email_address, email

from_address.description: The from address of this user

bcc_email_address.description: Address that will be BBC'd on all emails from this user

email_signature_click_tracking_disabled.description: Whether this user has click tracking disabled in email signature

local_dial_enabled.description: Whether this user has Local Dial enabled

click_to_call_enabled.description: Whether this user has click to call enabled

email_client_configured.description: Whether this user has a email client configured

crm_connected.description: Whether the user has a crm connected

external_feature_flags.description: Feature flags that are for this user. New flags may appear or disappear at any time

_href.description: Resource URL, pointed at your API version, present if this resource is available in the API

created_at.description: Datetime of when the team was created

updated_at.description: Datetime of when the team was last updated

group_privacy_setting.description:
Visibility setting for resources across the team. Possible values are: group_public, all_public.
When the value is group_public, certain resources will only be visible to members of the same group.
When the value is all_public, all resources are visible to all users on this team.

team_visibility_default.description:
The default visibility of resources on the team, in the UI only. The API does not utilize this default.
Possible values are: public, private.

plan.description: Plan type of the team, Possible values are: group, professional, enterprise

license_limit.description: Count of seats that this team has licensed

local_dial_enabled.description: Whether this team has local dial enabled

record_by_default.description: Whether calls will record by default

call_recording_disabled.description: Whether all call recording is disabled

email_daily_limit.description: Daily email limit for each member on the team

click_tracking_default.description: The team default for click tracking when composing emails

allow_automated_email_steps.description: Whether team members are allowed to have automated email steps

custom_tracking_domain.description: The domain click and open tracking will be proxied through

dispositions_required.description: Whether team members are required to mark disposition at the end of calls

sentiments_required.description: Whether team members are required to log sentiments

created_at.description: Datetime of when the Account was created

updated_at.description: Datetime of when the Account was last updated

archived_at.description: Datetime of when the Account was archived, if archived

name.example: Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry

domain.description: Website domain, not a fully qualified URI

description.example: British school of magic for students

size.description: Estimated number of people in employment

crm_object_type.description: CRM object type, currently Salesforce.com only

owner_crm_id.description: Mapped owner field from the CRM, currently Salesforce.com only

last_contacted_at.description: Datetime this Account was last contacted

last_contacted_type.description: The type of the last touch to this Account. Can be call, email, other

do_not_contact.description: Whether this company has opted out of communications. Do not contact someone at this company when this is set to true

custom_fields.description: Custom fields are defined by the user's team. Only fields with values are presented in the API.

tags.description: All tags applied to this Account

owner.description: User that is marked as the owner of this Account

last_contacted_by.description: User that last contacted this Account

last_contacted_person.description: Person who was last contacted at this Account

company_stage.description: Company Stage that this Account has set. This is referred to as Account Stage in other parts of the API. When sorting by account_stage, the company stage's order is used

account_tier.description: Account Tier that this Account has set

people.description: Number of people in SalesLoft associated with this Account

created_at.description: Datetime of when the Account Stage was created

updated_at.description: Datetime of when the Account Stage was last updated

order.description: The order of the account tier

created_at.description: Datetime of when the Account Tier was created

updated_at.description: Datetime of when the Account Tier was last updated

created_at.description: Datetime of when the Action was created

updated_at.description: Datetime of when the Action was last updated

type.description: The type of this action. Valid types are: email, phone, other. New types may be added in the future.

status.description:
The current state of the person on the cadence. Possible values are:

in_progress: this action has not been completed

pending_activity: this action has been acted upon, but the action has not been completed.
(i.e. the email is scheduled to send, but has not been delivered yet)

created_at.description: Datetime of when the call instructions were created

updated_at.description: Datetime of when the call instructions were last updated

instructions.example: Call once, leave voicemail if not answered. Conference conversation.

updated_at.description: Datetime of when the Activity was last updated

created_at.description: Datetime of when the cadence was created

updated_at.description: Datetime of when the cadence was last updated

archived_at.description: Datetime of when the cadence was archived, if archived

team_cadence.description: Whether this cadence is a team cadence.  A team cadence is created by an admin and can be run by all users

shared.description: Whether this cadence is visible to team members (shared)

remove_bounces_enabled.description: Whether this cadence is configured to automatically remove people who have bounced

remove_replies_enabled.description: Whether this cadence is configured to automatically remove people who have replied

opt_out_link_included.description: Whether this cadence is configured to include an opt-out link by default

tags.description: All tags applied to this cadence

owner.description: User that is marked as the owner of this cadence

bounced_stage.description: Stage set when person on cadence bounces

replied_stage.description: Stage set when person on cadence replies

added_stage.description: Stage set when person is added to cadence

finished_stage.description: Stage set when person is finished with cadence

cadence_people.description: The number of people that have ever been added to the cadence

target_daily_people.description: The user defined target for number of people to add to the cadence each day

added_at.description: Datetime of when the person was last added to this cadence

created_at.description: Datetime of when the person was first added to this cadence

updated_at.description: Datetime of when the record was last updated

person_deleted.description: Whether the associated person has since been deleted

currently_on_cadence.description: Whether the person is currently on the cadence

current_state.description:
The current state of the person on the cadence. Possible values are:

processing: The person is being processed on a cadence. Cadence-related changes cannot be made at this time

staged: The person is waiting for the first step in the cadence to occur

active: The cadence has begun processing this person and is still in the process, but idle

scheduled: The cadence has begun processing this person and is still in the process, with an activity scheduled to occur

completed: The cadence has been completed for this person

removed: The person was manually or automatically removed from the cadence

removed_no_action: The person was removed from the cadence before any action occurred

reassigned: The person's cadence execution was transferred to a different user, ending this user's interaction

cadence.description: The cadence that the person is on

person.description: The person that is on the cadence

user.description: The user that is acting on the person in the cadence

latest_action.description: The most recent action associated with the record

views.description: The number of times emails sent from the cadence to the person were opened

clicks.description: The number of times emails sent from the cadence to the person were clicked

replies.description: The number of times emails sent from the cadence to the person were replied to

calls.description: The number of times a call was logged from the cadence to the person

sent_emails.description: The number of times emails were sent from the cadence to the person

bounces.description: The number of times emails sent from the cadence to the person bounced

created_at.description: Datetime of when the call was created

updated_at.description: Datetime of when the call was last updated

to.description: Phone number that received the call

from.description: Phone number that placed the call

duration.description: Length of the call in seconds

direction.description: Direction of the call. Can be one of: inbound, outbound

status.description: The outcome of the call. Can be one of: queued, initiated, ringing, in-progress, completed, busy, no-answer, canceled, failed

call_type.description: Type of the call. Can be one of: call, bridge, collaboration. Though exact values may change over time

call_uuid.description: UUID of the call. Legs of the same call will have the same call_uuid.

recording.description: The recording for this this call data record, with a status

call.description: Call that this record was logged to, if logged to a call

user.description: User that made or received the call, if the call was to a user

status.description:
The status of the call that produced this recording. Possible values are (but not limited to):

no-answer: The call was not answered

failed: The call was not able to be placed

busy: The call was busy

ringing: The call is ringing

in-progress: The call is ongoing

completed: The call is finished

recording_status.description:
The processing status of the recording. Possible values are (but not limited to):

not_recorded: there is no recording available, and there will not be one becoming available

pending: the recording is currently being processed by the system

processing: the recording is currently being processed by the system

completed: the recording processing has been completed

created_at.description: Datetime of when the call disposition was created

updated_at.description: Datetime of when the call disposition was last updated

to.description: Phone number that received the call

duration.description: Length of the call in seconds

created_at.description: Datetime of when the call was created

updated_at.description: Datetime of when the call was last updated

recordings.description: The recordings for this this call and their status

crm_activity.description: CRM Activity associated with the call

cadence.description: Cadence the call was made on

step.description: Step the call was made on

created_at.description: Datetime of when the call sentiment was created

updated_at.description: Datetime of when the call sentiment was last updated

display_name.description: The name of the person calling

title.description: The title of the person calling

account_name.description: The account of the person calling

created_at.description: Datetime of when the CrmActivityField was created

updated_at.description: Datetime of when the CrmActivityField was last updated

title.description: A human friendly title for this field

salesforce_object_type.description:
The Salesforce object type that this field maps to. Valid object types are: Task.
More object types may be added in the future.

source.description: SalesLoft object that this field is mapped for. Valid sources are: email, phone

field_type.description: The type of this field in Salesforce. Certain field types can only accept structured input.

value.description:
A value to always be written. This value does not need to be sent to other endpoints' crm params,
but must be the exact value if sent. Email source fields will always have a value present.

picklist_values.description:
Valid picklist values, if present for this field. The format is {label => value}. If present, only
values in the picklist structure can be used as a crm param.

created_at.description: Datetime of when the crm activity was created

updated_at.description: Datetime of when the crm activity was last updated

subject.description: The subject field of the activity in Salesforce

description.description: The description field of the activity in Salesforce
description.example: Timeline is 2 weeks for demo, set with Kate

crm_id.description: The ID of the activity in Salesforce, if written to Salesforce

activity_type.description: The type of activity that is being recorded, if available. The values can change over time, but could be one of: email, phone, email reminder, inmail

error.description: Information about why this crm activity failed to sync, if it did fail to sync. Failed activities will be automatically retried and may become successful in the future

custom_crm_fields.description: Additional fields that are logged to Salesforce, if mapped by the team at the time of writing to Salesforce

person.description: Person that this crm activity is for

user.description: User that triggered this crm activity

field_type.description: Type of the Custom Field. Value must be one of: person, company, opportunity.

value_type.description: Value Type of the Custom Field. Value must be one of: text, date.

created_at.description: Datetime of when the Custom Field was created

updated_at.description: Datetime of when the Custom Field was last updated

created_at.description: Datetime of when the email was created

updated_at.description: Datetime of when the email was last updated

status.description: Status of this email through the sending process. Possible values are: sent, sent_from_gmail, sent_from_external, pending, pending_reply_check, scheduled, sending, delivering, failed, cancelled, pending_through_gmail, pending_through_external

send_after.description: When this email will be sent, or null if already sent

sent_at.description: When this email was sent, or null if it was not sent

view_tracking.description: Whether this email had view tracking enabled

click_tracking.description: Whether this email had click tracking enabled

headers.description: Selected headers that are included if this email used them. Available keys are: cc, bcc

recipient.description: The person whom received this email

mailing.description: The mailing that this email was a part of

action.description: Action that this email was sent from, or null if not sent through a cadence

crm_activity.description: CRM Activity associated with this email

cadence.description: Cadence the email was sent on

step.description: Step the email was sent on

clicks.description: The number of times links in the email were clicked

views.description: The number of times the email was opened

replies.description: The number of replies the email received

unique_devices.description: The number of unique devices that opened the email

unique_locations.description: The number of unique locations that opened the email

attachments.description: The number of attachments on the email

id.description: ID of email template attachment association

attachment_id.description: ID of the email template attachment

email_template.description: Link and id of specific email template

body.description: Sanitized body of the email template without email signature
body.example:
Welcome to the SalesLoft family! My name is Sarah and Im your implementation consultant. Im here to get you up and running. It's my job to help you configure your team's SalesLoft access, provide customized training for your specific goals, and make sure that you and your team are ready to crush your goals.

Thank you,

body_preview.description: A plain text version of the first 100 characters of the body of the email template
body_preview.example:
hello

hey sounds good

ok

ok

with an edit

ok now i'm comic sans 14

created_at.description: Datetime of when the email template was created

updated_at.description: Datetime of when the email template was last updated

last_used_at.description: Datetime of when the email template was last used

archived_at.description: Datetime of when the email template was archived, if archived

shared.description: Whether this email template is visible to team members (shared)

open_tracking_enabled.description: Whether open tracking is enabled for this email template

click_tracking_enabled.description: Whether click tracking is enabled for this email template

cadence_template.description: Whether this email template is only used on a cadence step. These templates are not visible in the SalesLoft application template list. If false, this email template is visible in the SalesLoft application, and may be used when composing an email or creating a cadence step.

counts.description: Various counts for this team template

template_owner.description: User that owns this email template

_links.description: Links to attachments and tags resources for this email template.

tags.description: All tags applied to this email template

groups.description: Groups to which this template is assigned, if any

sent_emails.description: The number of times the email template was sent out

views.description: The number of times the email template was opened

clicks.description: The number of times links in the email template were clicked

replies.description: The number of replies the email template received

bounces.description: The number of bounces the email template received

created_at.description: Datetime of when the import was created

updated_at.description: Datetime of when the import was last updated, ignoring relationship changes

current_people_count.description: Count of People that have not been deleted

imported_people_count.description: Count of People that have ever been on this Import

parameters.description: A SalesLoft identifier

content.example: Was very interested in a demo at a later time

created_at.description: Datetime of when the note was created

updated_at.description: Datetime of when the note was last updated

associated_with.description: Item on which the note was made

created_at.description: Datetime of when the person was created

updated_at.description: Datetime of when the person was last updated

last_contacted_at.description: Last datetime this person was contacted

last_replied_at.description: Last datetime this person replied to an email

display_name.description: Either the full name or the email address. Use this when showing a person's name

crm_object_type.description: CRM object type, currently Salesforce.com only

owner_crm_id.description: Mapped owner field from the CRM, currently Salesforce.com only

person_company_name.description: Company name. This property is specific to this person, unrelated to the company object. Updating the company object associated with this person is recommended

person_company_website.description: Company website. This property is specific to this person, unrelated to the company object. Updating the company object associated with this person is recommended

person_company_industry.description: Company industry. This property is specific to this person, unrelated to the company object. Updating the company object associated with this person is recommended

do_not_contact.description: Whether or not this person has opted out of all communication. Setting this value to true prevents this person from being called, emailed, or added to a cadence in SalesLoft. If this person is currently in a cadence, they will be removed.

bouncing.description: Whether this person's current email address has bounced

twitter_handle.description: The twitter handle of this person

last_contacted_type.description: The type of the last touch to this person. Can be call, email, other

job_seniority.description: The Job Seniority of a Person, must be one of director, executive, individual_contributor, manager, vice_president, unknown

custom_fields.description: Custom fields are defined by the user's team. Only fields with values are presented in the API.

tags.description: All tags applied to this person

contact_restrictions.description: Specific methods of communication to prevent for this person. This will prevent individual execution of these communication types as well as automatically skip cadence steps of this communication type for this person in SalesLoft. Values currently accepted: call, email, message

account.description: Account that this person is associated to

owner.description: User that is marked as the owner of this person

last_contacted_by.description: User that last contacted this person

import.description: Import that this person was a part of

person_stage.description: Person stage that this person has set

emails_sent.description: The number of emails sent to this person

emails_viewed.description: The number of unique emails viewed by this person

emails_clicked.description: The number of unique emails clicked by this person

emails_replied_to.description: The number of unique emails replied to by this person

emails_bounced.description: The number of unique emails sent to this person that bounced

calls.description: The number of calls logged to this person

created_at.description: Datetime of when the Person Stage was created

updated_at.description: Datetime of when the Person Stage was last updated

number.description: The phone number associated with this assignment

user.description: User associated with this phone number assignment

recording_default.description: Whether this phone number should record by default

view_params.description: List of set filters in saved list view

is_default.description: Whether the saved list view is the default view

created_at.description: Datetime of when the Step was created

updated_at.description: Datetime of when the Step was last updated

disabled.description: Whether this step is currently active

type.description: The type of the action scheduled by this step. Valid types are: email, phone, integration, other. New types may be added in the future.

day.description: Day this step is associated with up

step_number.description: The number of the step for this day

details.description: Details pertaining to the specific step type

created_at.description: Datetime of when the success was created

updated_at.description: Datetime of when the success was last updated

succeeded_at.description: Datetime of when the success was recorded

success_window_started_at.description: Datetime of when this person was first worked, leading up to the success

person.description: The person who a success occurred on

latest_email.description: The email that was most recently sent to this person before the success

latest_call.description: The call that was most recently made to this person before the success

latest_action.description: The action that was most recently completed on this person before the success

latest_cadence.description: The cadence with the action that was most recently completed on this person before the success

total_emails.description: The total number of emails made in this success window

total_calls.description: The total number of calls made in this success window

total_other_touches.description: The total number of other touches made in this success window

id.description: ID of team template attachment association

attachment_id.description: ID of the team template attachment

team_template.description: Details pertaining to the specific team template

body.example:
Do you know about birds?
You can find them here:https://www.allaboutbirds.org/guide/search/

body_preview.description: A plain text version of the first 100 characters of the body of the team template
body_preview.example:
hello

hey sounds good

ok

ok

with an edit

ok now i'm comic sans 14

created_at.description: Datetime of when the team template was created

updated_at.description: Datetime of when the team template was last updated

last_used_at.description: Datetime of when the team template was last used

archived_at.description: Datetime of when the team template was archived, if archived

last_modified_at.description: Datetime of when the team template was last modified

open_tracking_enabled.description: Whether open tracking is enabled for this team template

click_tracking_enabled.description: Whether click tracking is enabled for this team template

counts.description: Various counts for this team template. Counts will update over time but will not affect the 'updated at' field for the team template.

last_modified_user.description: User that last modified this team template

_links.description: Links to attachments resource for this template

tags.description: All tags applied to this team template

sent_emails.description: The number of times the team template was sent out

views.description: The number of times the team template was opened

clicks.description: The number of times links in the team template were clicked

replies.description: The number of replies the team template received

bounces.description: The number of bounces the team template received
